title: Doctor won’t do home visits
body:
I am a vulnerable person and registered as house bound. Rang up the Doctors to get a home visit. Only too be told they no longer do them and ring 111. Could not use 111 as it was constantly engaged.
Where do I turn to?!death would be welcome at times as there is no one else to turn too. 
Sad reflection of our so called caring society.

author: Roman2020
title: Thankful for you all
body:
It started with a High temperature, so got tested quickly for Covid. The following day I had cellulitis in my leg (had it once before so knew it was that). Got antibiotics for that, unfortunately they weren't working great so ended up my Dr telling me to go to hospital, got seen initially by a becs nurse practitioner, ended up with a cannula put in and iv antibiotics. Was in and out of hospital for 3 days getting iv drip. After that was on a 10day course of antibiotics. Got a phonecall to go back in to get bloods checked as something flagged up in liver function. So went back into get it checked and all was fine. Finished the 10 day course, but it still wasn't quite cleared do had another course for 5 days. It's getting there, only thing now is my foot swelling up.  
So would like to thank Braeside practice staff (reception, also Dr MacDonald who seen me at a drop of a hat)  
Becs staff, the medical team of Dr's Ambulatory care, Pauline from transfusion dept. Covid 19 hub.  
You are all truly amazing and very thankful for you all and our NHS Borders

author: Jjamie
title: The best health service anyone could wish for
body:
Had to have a basal cell Carcinoma removed at Forth Valley Royal in Larbert.  
I was taken on time and greeted by David who was the surgeon doing the procedure.  
He asked me a few questions, due to the current situation of Covid. Then went through to the room where he introduced Lee-Anne who was assisting.  
David took the time to explain what the basal cell Carcinoma was, the procedure, asked if I had any questions.  
During the procedure, both David and Lee-Anne talked to me, I would say they had excellent rapport (banter).  
All in all I would say they are a credit to the best health service anyone could wish for. As I felt at ease the whole time, before I knew it, the procedure was done and i was heading home.

author: ClearYourMinds
title: Mental Health Awareness and Influences
body:
Cleaning helps a lot and in a public working and visited space. Patients are sometimes free of negative thoughts from self care and better environments are helpful.  
Always be positive. Mental notes have always helped me. Stay apart and respect space from staff workers and patients. Positive world's matter through positive actions.  
Not fixing all problems with work in the space of a day. It takes time but safety from prolonged stress or environmental negative impact of neglected mental health awareness helps.

author: paisley2505
title: Not the best patient care
body:
My grandpa was recently admitted to SATA after a fall where he had lain all night and developed a temperature. The care he received in SATA was second to none and the staff were amazing! He was then transferred to ward 15 where again the staff were amazing! My grandpa is 90 and has dementia. The staff in ward 15 had him up out of bed singing and dancing and I cannot thank them enough!  
He was then transferred to ward 8 and this is where the problems began. He was left in bed all day, not changed into his own pajamas despite having at least 3 clean pairs and the patient in the bed next to him commented how he cried all day and not one member of staff came to see if he was OK. My grandpa is no longer able to feed himself and despite this the staff left him to feed himself which he was unable to do and his lunch therefore ended up all over the floor and himself. On one occasion I was helping him to eat when staff members, who I felt were very rude, gave me into trouble for actually helping him!  
I understand that all staff are very busy but to leave a 90 year old man with advanced dementia sitting in a chair all day every day for weeks with little or no stimulation is completely unacceptable. He was so upset and the change in him from ward 15 to ward 8 was terrible. By the time he left ward 8 he couldn't walk and had developed delirium.  
As an NHS employee I completely understand how busy everyone is and the extreme pressure everyone has and are continuing to face however we cannot forget that we are nursing extremely vulnerable patients and it is extremely upsetting for them also to be away from family for long periods without any visitors.

readBy.name: Yorkshire & Humber Patient Safety Research Collaboration
Plymouth University Health and Human Sciences students, 2018

author: CRD
title: Not being able to get an appointment
body:
So, I have a history with depression and anxiety, and the last few months both have got really bad. I know loads of coping mechanisms and tricks to feeling better but at this point I need outside help; therapy and medication. I have been trying to get a doctor's appointment for almost a month now. I've tried calling, both at normal times and in the time slot for the emergency surgery, and I haven't got through once. Sometimes I'll get a recorded message saying to call at another time, I do and still don't get through. Today I got one saying "to get this number please call [a different number]". I called it and the number was not regognised. I know these are busy times but I've been seriously needing an appointment for over a month, and constantly trying to fit in phoning the sugary, when phone calls give me anxiety, has been really rough.  
I have tried using the online appointment system but this didn't work either. They seem to be half way through transitioning between two websites. The first says they've moved and the second says they haven't got that surgery yet. And I can't seem to log into either of them with some information I'm told I have to go to the surgery for. The surgery's doors are closed they only let you in if you have an appointment. So as far as I can see there is no way for me to book an appointment online and I can't get in contact by phone.  
What am I supposed to do?

author: Weeme85
title: Recent appointment
body: I had a phone appointment with a new psychiatrist who had never met me before and this has been my 7th one. I don’t trust people easily and I feel I need to start from the beginning every time. Don’t get me wrong, they seemed very nice because and did more than any other temp has done for me. I feel with appointments like these would be better done through the NHS attend anywhere and this should be an option for people. I suffer from an emotional unstable personality disorder, anxiety and hear voices.

author: phoenixhm99
title: They go the extra mile
body: Care from start to finish was phenomenal. Paramedics attending the scene were friendly and knowledgeable and staff on the ward (33) are hard working, well organised and go the extra mile to make you feel comfortable and cared for. A credit to themselves and the NHS. All deserve a pay-rise and A holiday!

author: Sadrg34
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Feedback for Physiotherapy
body:
I greatly appreciate my sessions with Sadie, and as I recovered I looked forward to, and thoroughly enjoyed, my weekly sessions in the gym.  
  
I was impressed with the way Sadie worked with me. She tailored exercises to my needs and abilities, and kept careful records of my progress (or lack of progress!) She also took pains to explain to me how particular exercises were designed to help with specific everyday activities. I found it helpful to know why a particular exercise was important.  
  
After discharge, I now feel motivated to do the exercises she gave me to do at home, and in due course (after Covid) I hope to join a balance and strengthening local group.  
  
On a personal level I liked Sadie a lot. She has an open and warm personality which made it very easy to get along with her.

author: MichH
title: Amazing care & attention
body:
Removal of Fallopian tubes and ovaries. Operation went well , I felt sick after the op for most of the day, but the care and attention of all the staff was amazing.  
I’ve woke up this morning feeling much better, thanks so much to ward 52

author: Blonde
title: Absolutely first-class
body: Absolutely first-class on Newlyn ward, especially the nurse in charge on Saturday the 12 September 2020, thank you.

author: Caroil
title: Skin lesion removal
body: David and Lesley excised a lesion on my right forearm. David explained the procedure and carried out the surgery most professionally and with a reassuring good sense of humour. Lesley also removed a seborrhoeic wart. I received first class care and attention.

author: jmc-20
title: Birth of my second child
body:
I had my second son during this pandemic and yet couldn't have had a better birth experience.  
Our midwife, Louise, was so lovely and made me feel at ease. I didn't imagine for a second I could have such a fear-free labour but I did. I was helped to feel in control the whole time and was so well looked after.  
I want to say a huge thank you to everyone on the midwife-led unit at Victoria Hospital, Kirkcaldy.

title: Incompetent Receptionist
body:
It's not often I leave any kind of review for anything really but having been warned by my wife that the receptionists here can be 'argumentative' which I have seen on the very few occasions I actually have visited, I do still like to give anyone the benefit of doubt.  Unfortunately, this faith is misguided.. I cannot see how any 'extra training' is going to rectify or improve a poor attitude, completely argumentative to anything you say or suggest and ultimately make you feel you are an inconvenience to them (so much so that I'd consider not bothering to call or visit due to the hassle and stress they exert... a dangerous environment for a doctors surgery).

This visit should have been routine, collecting a print-off for a repeat prescription for my child and a prescription for my wife also.  Apparently, she cannot accept verbal requests for this documentation and require an email, she was straight on the offensive soo much (even when I pointed out I just wanted the form to tick the boxes to then get the prescription), she was completely unhelpful bordering rude so I gave up with that and said I wont bother (won't bother to get my sons inhaler and insulin.... completely unimportant right) and my wife will have to sort... oh can I collect her repeat prescription you have in stock.. to be told that's a different dept and I'd have to ask the pharmacy and get back to you.. couldn't be made  to feel any more awkward and inconvenient if she'd tried (shocking people skills).. on being asked if I had prescription paperwork for that - I again gave up and left.

On speaking to my wife, an email cannot be sent for a child prescription request so that info is completely incorrect.  It seems as if the receptionist gives completely conflicting information and ends up tying herself up in a web of her own misinformation.  Very disappointing that so many reviews on here are attributed to the receptionists incompetence but I'm afraid until the situation is  addressed I cannot see anything improving.

title: Complete lack of organisation
body:
Based on our first meeting with the unit who will be performing the most important task of our lives so far - the delivery of our first child - I have been left petrified.
We arrived 30 minutes before our appointment time for our 12 week scan(as requested) and did not leave the hospital for 5 hours.
The team obviously has no system for managing who is waiting for what, who arrived when, what time people’s appointments where meant to be and proceeded to ignore us and call in people who arrived hours after us and who then proceeded to leave hours before us.
Our appointment took 5 hours in total where others were there for less than 2 probably even less than that.
You need to sort out your management 
You need to address your care of patients needs and you need to pull your socks up because quite frankly I have zero faith in your department’s competence now. 

There were nurses clearly not doing their job- instead playing with relatives who happened to be in the unit at the time - one lady spent the entirety of our stay playing with her granddaughter. She was eventually told to do her job by what looked like a senior nurse. I found this particularly disrespectful when the waiting room was full of pregnant women waiting around unnecessarily.
This first appointment exhausted both of us and ruined what should have been a lovely day.

title: Good practice
body:
Helpful and efficient.Good quality premises with Pharmacy attached. Reassuring Covid prevention protocols. Website well designed.
Drug reordering process frustrating. Restrictions on when you can reorder the mean you can't order the week before you run out of meds is excessive.

title: Presciption Debacle
body: Today 14/09/20, I phoned the surgery, at 0800 hrs, after waiting 30 mins, I admit it is a Monday and the centre is busy, I finally got through and asked to speak to the person who deals with the prescriptions, after 12 rings I got cut off, I tried again and after 25 minutes got transferred only to be cut off yet again, this is a repeat review as I contacted you last week about my wife’s debacle with her prescription pain killers she needs, and the fact we are on holiday from today at midday, and my wife has  no pain killers, this about a review needed for a repeat prescriptions, yet my wife was given other tablets in August that needed a review  July and the tablets I collected today a review was needed in July as it says on the repeat prescription, and as for contacting you it is impossible to find a email address for yourself or phone number, so when we return from holiday I will be contacting you yet again to see if the painkiller my wife needs is available for collection.

title: Flu vacination
body: Have been messaged asking to review your flu jab clinic.  Organisation was brilliant - in and out in a flash, plenty of guidance and all staff cheerful and helpful

title: Comfortable transition
body:
I just wanted to write a short comment to say what a relief it was to confirm a placement for my mother at Charlotte house during COVID. Her move from hospital to home was smooth and the staff did what they could to make this as easy as possible.

The family and I know she is safe and in caring hands. The staff are very helpful and well versed in infection control measure necessary to keep all the residents safe. 

When I visit, the team know what is going on and make every effort to keep us as a family involved in my mums care. 

Keep up the good work - we are all in for a tough year. 

Thank you

title: Impossible to get an appointment
body:
My experience is this surgery puts every block in the way they can to avoid you seeing your doctor. I say your doctor but of course that concept no longer exists at that surgery, you just get randomly assigned.
P.S. never join the virtual queue they never ring back.

title: Couldn't organise a "drinks evening" in a brewery…
body: Had my operation cancelled without being informed. Tried to contact them and had my emails ignored. Still being left in the dark as to what is going on and getting the run around in their joke of a phone system whenever I try to find out.

title: Fantastic staff
body:
I was admitted to SAU from A&E on Thursday night and despite obvious strain on A&E due to the sheer volume of people accessing the service, all staff from reception to senior medical staff shown kindness and understanding towards me at what had been a very scary time.
They all are amazing and the housekeeper on gate 36 and her colleagues just went out of their way to make me feel comfortable.
Fabulous teamwork. Thank you to every single person

title: Great Experience - Thank You !!!
body:
I would like to express my warmest thanks to the staff of the Nelson, who handled my walk-visit on Saturday because I had run out of medication (my fault).  We were treated with great kindness, professionalism and courtesy.   We are especially grateful to your two colleagues on the front desk who could not have been kinder or more helpful. I would like to thank the doctor who made time to sign the prescription. I would like to thank the pharmacists who prepared the medication immediately.   The visit was completed in minutes !
I would also like to take this opportunity to thank my podiatrist, who has treated me throughout the pandemic.   
We are all very proud of you !!!
Yours faithfully

David Marsden
Wimbledon

title: On hold
body: On hold for 1 hour 7 minutes 6th in queue and 45 minutes 1st in queue, I understand it’s difficult at moment but surely not that hard to answer phone, unfortunately I had to hang up as my phone got to hot, it’s bad enough Normally you have to listen to 2min and 30sec of dribble to be cut off

title: Excellent Practice
body: My wife and I can't fault the terrific service we receive at the Microfaculty from GP's, the Nurses and Reception staff. Thoroughly professional, helpful and dedicated in all respects.

title: Non answered phone call
body: I have been on a phone call to this surgery for 97 minutes!!number 9 in the queue for 31 of those minutes,66 of those minutes at caller number 1!!!!not very happy

title: Difficulty getting an appointment
body:
It took me a while to get an appointment. I had to politely challenge the receptionist for an appointment.
I eventually got one (thank you). As a matter of fact, I was called back and offered a telephone appointment which went very well.
However I've been on the phone for 2 days trying to get an appointment for a blood test!
Very frustrating experience, still no joy!!!!!

title: Great practice
body: An excellent surgery, after years struggling with an eating disorder, they treat me successfully and refer me to a specialist for care. Everyone from receptionist, to all the doctors were excellent, great and sympathetic. My care was the most important thing for them. I can honestly say that the surgery is amazing.

title: Flu clinic
body:
A slick and well organised clinic very efficient and a great team supporting the patients and staff
Well done

title: Flu vaccination
body:
Myself and my wife both attended the practice on Saturday 12th September for flu vaccinations
We were met at the door by a member of the practice who questioned us about covid symptoms. When we confirmed that we had no symptoms she then asked if we were alright to climb the stairs. When we said we were she then directed us to the first floor. At the top of the stairs we were met by another member of staff who completed a short questionnaire and then directed to a room along the corridor. There was a doctor waiting at the door of the room who did the vaccinations.
There were signs directing us out of the building. The one way system worked very well and we didn’t come within two metres of anyone else apart from the three members of staff mentioned above.
We were in the building for no more than five minutes

title: Communication issues
body: I attempted to follow the procedure to make an appointment this morning. When I phoned the number the message said i had dialled incorrectly. I tried several more times including dialling by clicking the link on the website - same message. After 45 minutes the phone rang through and I listened to a message to say I was caller 15. I held until I was caller 11 and then the phone cut out. By this point it was too late to make an appointment.My elderly parents have described similar problems to me over the past weeks. It is simply not good enough. I also feel that the messages read out to suggest ways of reducing caller traffic are potentially very confusing and inaccessible to elderly people particularly in their reference to the online methods of making contact. I have seen messages to say that there are only 6 or 10 people answering phones and understand the difficulties social distancing poses but the messaging system  needs to improve to take account of this. Some people would have believed that they had the wrong number and not persisted. I eventually decided to do the electronic referral form which was mentioned but the form would not open on the first 3 occasions that I tried. I left it for a few hours and have now completed it. Either the practice has too many patients or an inadequate infrastructure to cope with them. This needs looking into urgently.

title: Very caring staff
body: I went for my flu jab and everything was very well organised I never felt unsafe and was in and out in 5 mins.  Well done

title: Friendly skilled professional and safe
body:
Appointment with Endoscopy unit 
Seen on time given very clear instructions and answers to all questions 
All felt very covid safe and comfortable throughout
All of the staff /consultants etc I met were excellent very professional and very informative 
At no point did I feel afraid or stressed 
Thanks to all involved

title: Flu clinic
body: Brilliantly organised flu Clinic  at the Local airfield.  Went like clockwork this morning.  It was their first day and, as far as I was concerned it went without a hitch.  They had thought of everything.  Well done.

title: Thoughtful and Caring
body: After being admitted to A&E after a fall and breaking my ankle it was made clear to me by the surgical team that I was going to need two lots of surgery to repair it.. I was sent for a 12 day stay on Ward 53, the Nursing team were fantastic.. I had little or no experience of ever staying in hospital before and the team up there couldn’t of done enough for me.. due to Covid-19 rules I was unable to have any visitors but the Nurses on Ward 53 kept my family and myself well informed and well looked after.. Each and everyone of the team should be commended, I shell never forget their care and kindness.. Thank You all from the bottom of my heart! X

readBy.name: University Hospitals Coventry and Warwickshire NHS Trust

title: Disorganised & Chaotic
body:
Well aware of this surgeries inability to pick the phone up (it has been like this for years. You often wait for 45 mins to 1hr to get through, if you can even connect in the first place) I have now used their e-consulting system. Simple and quick. 

Except that after two call backs (Receptionist to book and then doctor for actual appointment) the doctor forgot to apply any notes afterwards. 

I've spent a month going backwards and forwards (I walk over to the surgery due to the phone issue mentioned earlier) being told there ARE notes on the system and to wait. Then there ARENT and they will look into it. Then there ARE notes once again but the issue is with another company who I've been referred to and to take it up with them. I contacted them. There is no referral.

...and then there ARENT notes on the system once again (At this point, the receptionist went from me being 'mistaken' to alluding I was lying, despite it being very clear on my record in front of her said that I have had an appointment yet the record of said appointment being empty).

I've been told on several occasions I'll get call backs as they look into the issue yet the phone doesn't ring. I have to chase later. Only once have they actually rung back - today - where they've told me I now need to start the entire process again, from scratch.

I am a month into an issue - one which stops me from working - and am no further down the line than I was on day one.

I've had so many frustrating experiences over the years with this surgery but moving from a place which is not very good but at least forgivable to currently just running patients around the houses or possibly even making it up as you go along to get rid of the problem in front of you for now is a big step too far.
This is not okay.

title: Flu Jab-new process
body: The actual drive though process was first class, very simple and effective. However, many of my neighbours did have problems actually booking an appointment as the times given on the letter are not really very long. I think a different booking process needs to be considered for next year. The process should be discussed at the next PRG meeting.

title: Appalling service
body: I have been unable to get through on the phone for months and unable to get an appointment for even longer. Really there is no point in this so called practice existing

title: Appears to be one of the best
body: My wife and I received a letter informing us of the system to be used. Originally we thought that telephoning for a slot may be difficult considering the size of the practice. However getting a drive through slot turned out to be easy. On the day we arrived with 4 minutes ahead of our allocated time, drove into a directed bay and received our flu shot without any fuss. Left a couple of minutes later. Job done. We must add that the marshalls and the doctor were both professional, personal and a pleasure to be dealt with. Thanks.

title: Great practice.
body: I called asking if I could speak with my dr at 9 am. The gentleman receptionist was extremely helpful, he said the dr would call me shortly. At 10.45 my dr called me. I felt that he really listened to me and felt no pressure to hurry up and get off the phone. I would say the reception staff and medical team really do care for the patients. Fabulous practice, I'm so happy I decided to join them.

title: Flew through the flu procedure
body: Arranged for yearly influenza injection on 12 September. Due to covid we opted for the drive through visit. Arrangements were organised via texts and a link that was easy to follow. As instructed arrived on time and we were registered on arrival and directed to bay 1 which was next to a tent in the car park. Doctor came out of tent made sure of our names and confirmed we had no egg allergies and proceeded to administer the inoculation to my wife who was driving and then to myself. Neither of us had to leave the car. Then off we went-all done. Easy.

title: Good care
body: All of the staff are caring and friendly.  I have been a patient there for over 40 years.  Appointments are easy to make either online or by phone.  A surgery nurse carries out many procedures at the practice.  I am confident that my welfare is important to them.

title: Communication and isolation of patients
body:
My mother was an inpatient for nearly four weeks up until her death. In that time we were allowed only 2 short visits. The lack of proactively about how we could communicate with her was lamentable . Owing to her frailty, confusion and disorientation- she couldn’t comprehend why we weren’t there - when we did finally get to see her she barely recognised us. 
On the day she died we were prevented from getting up to see her in a timely manner and then couldn’t get into the ward as no one answered the intercom- by then it was too late. 
Absolute travesty  that we were unable to be there for our mum when she needed us most.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)
Ashford and St Peter's Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Terrible admin
body:
The front of house reception desk is nearly non existant.
God forbid you need a telephone appointment because even if you do get through to a ringing phone after 20 minutes on hold it will get put down as it is ringing 9 times out of 10.

Even when you visit the centre in person you will clearly see the reception staff completely blank the phone to talk to each other or other paitients. It is genuinely beyond unaccepable how this can be ignored by senior members of staff considering how long the phone issuse has been going on, the complaints pile back months and months.

Please for the sake of your practice make a serious reform in your reception staff they alone are runining a perfectly fine practice overall.

title: Beyond Outstanding Practice
body:
Having moved to Whitstable 6 years ago, I feel blessed to be within the catchment area for this practice.
My GP is an outstanding professional, who goes above and beyond in so many ways. I have had a number of occasions when I can honestly say that she may have saved my life. There were times when things were extremely difficult and I could see no way out; during these times she was kind, patient and practical. Not only did she treat me with conventional medications, on a short term basis - but she also ensured I had longer term complementary talking therapies available to me. My GP never once made me feel that my issues were unimportant or that I was taking up her precious time with something trivial. I always had her full attention, she empathised and most importantly she listened. 
Whatever the issue might have been over the past 6 years, both my partner and myself have enjoyed a truly wonderful service from the team at this practice. 
We both feel very grateful to have such a caring and cutting edge practice at our disposal. It is a flagship institution and my own personal GP is worth their weight in gold.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Quick & easy Flu Jab
body: We used the drive in facility to get our flu jab this year. Very well organised, quick and easy. Felt safer than going in to the surgery and was considerably quicker.

title: Impossible to contact them!
body: I understand that GPs are stretched during the Coronavirus pandemic but... how do you actually book an appointment, get information etc.  Spent over 2 hours trying to get through to the practice just for it to relay the recorded message over and over and then cut off.  After 12 - 15 attempts I decided to walk to the GPs, and after waiting in the queue I eventually got to the front of the line and was told that they could not do anything because I have made an appointment and told to ring first... Do you see my problem???

title: Good experience
body:
Great drive through set up for flu jab
Well done what a great way to stop us having to go into the surgery.

title: Excellent practice
body: This practice,  it’s staff and Doctors are dedicated to providing a service second to none.  I have found that this practice always (without exception) go the ‘extra mile’ to provide the best health care for their patients.  The Grosvenor Practice should be a bench mark for all practices.

title: Very professional
body: Flu Jan under Covid lockdown very efficient and speedy, arrived at the correct time, on one door out the other, all done in a few miny

title: Efficient practice
body: Very well organized regarding administration of flu vaccine. Very polite and helpful staff. No waiting at all. Very pleasant experience.

title: Excellent practice
body: My wife and i went for our flu jabs at an arranged time given to us by letter.From arriving to completing the task was very slick well thought out and totally safe.Thanks to all involved,we find this practice is excellent all the time and we have been patients for more years than i care to remember.

title: Not fit for purpose
body:
It is hard to in short put into words the experience I had with this service. 
On the one hand, in the last part of using the service, I have been seen by the most professional, interested, helpful and caring individual I could have wished for. Unfortunately for most of the further experience, I would agree, the previous post is very accurate. My experience with an other individual has been very difficult. Problems in communication; always asked the same not very relevant questions from a set list and after answering these, no following up interest. It seems only a yes or no answer was being asked for. My feeling, my experience and conditions was never really discussed in a empathetic manner, it was all just awkward, these on avourage 10 minute appointments. And understanding that one person can't be an expert on all conditions, still to be so unknowledgeable on my condition was alarming to me. Eventually, I felt like I needed to stir the conversation towards useful topics, but this, after the end of  the conversation, let me to be discharged, without informing the team, GP or me first and with a condition still to be treated. The complexity of my situation seemed too difficult and I seemed a burden for asking for help. At best, 4 or 5 years has been wasted with this individual, a time I could have spend on getting real help.
I am aware going private is not an option for many, but if you can, the cost could be so much less to your mental state. Please believe your loved ones when they express they are having a real negative experience here, they might end up needing your support even more then when they first got here. On the whole, including other professionals, I can only say the system is not fit for purpose. I can just give it a one star rating, despite the reception staff seeming friendly and the fantastic treatment I have received by this one most recent individual which turned out to be sadly a rare occuring experience it seems. Sad as I would give this person and one other professional a 5 out of 5 star rating, especially a pity to them, as they were working in a very challenging environment, but there is only so much you can make up for others lack of care. (Ps, non of this was due to effects of the virus outbreak)

title: Great continuity of care
body: When I listen to my family and friends I'm aware how difficult it is to get an appointment with a regular GP or nurse. This is not the case at this surgery. The friendly receptionist always does her best to get me an appointment with my usual GP or if it's urgent and she isn't available on that day, I can always get a call back from one of the other regular GPs. The nurses and the phlebotomist have been with the surgery for years. Continuity of care is, I believe, really important to maintain health and this is perfectly possible at Wellside Surgery.

title: Great service
body:
Friendly efficient staff offering great
service .
Follow up for test results also done
in a timely manner .

title: The Highest Levels of Care
body:
I had the misfortune of recently being hospitalised, but I can honestly say that Eastbourne District General Hospital was outstanding in its care and compassion through A&E, AMU and onwards to Berwick Ward.

From the cleaning standards, to the porters, the care staff, the radiology team, phlebotomy and catering, everything and everyone played their part in my recovery. Thank you.

author: MISS ASB
title: Communication
body: My daughter was admitted in early September with urinary sepsis, in MAU she was very unwell with temp spiking to 40.9 at times, she was given a ultrasound and it detected a bladder stone also she had pyelonephritis, on visiting her two days later the Dr explained she would either get her stones blasted that night or the next morning. Unfortunately she was moved to ward 4 overnight during that morning she was told she would be going for a ultrasound even though she explained she had been for one the previous day. The staff told her there was no documentation of this happening, On 2nd ultrasound showed no stones which the dr in MAU said she wouldn’t be able to pass it as it was 1cm (so where’s it went) she was taken off IV antibiotics as her temp and heartrate came down, But would have to have them orally. She was discharged after a further two days, to be told her discharge letter and antibiotics would be sent to her home with the blood bikes, on visiting her at 19.30pm they still hadn’t arrived. She was due to take them at 1800hrs and she still wasn’t feeling to good. At 20. 00 I phoned bgh and the problem was immediately sorted by the senior nurse. They phoned me back to say that the problem was that someone had forgotten to send them. This nurse managed to get them to my daughter, to which I’m very grateful for as I did not want her to be readmitted.I’m very aware at these times they are all run off their feet, and the staff on all shifts were extremely nice especially in A&E and MAU also the few I met in ward 4 was also very nice, but I think it was still worth mentioning they forgot to give her her much needed antibiotics.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students
Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Lack of respect
body: I explained I was terrified of internal exam. It was still excessively long and unnecessarily painful. When finished I was shaking and upset. I was not comforted but instead insensitively reminded to clear up after myself.

title: Great hospital
body: Had surgery here and was very nervous. I was a NHS referral but that made no difference at all. I was treated with great care and dignity and all members of staff were amazing and my surgeon was outstanding. Never thought I would say a hospital is a lovely place but this one at brentwood is. During this time with covid every precaution was taken and I felt very safe. Thank you to you all.

title: Brilliant telephone appointment
body: I booked a telephone appointment on line.  The morning of the appointment I was sent a text message asking me to upload a photo, which I did. I then received a response via text and relevant prescription was collected later that day. Brilliant idea in the world we live in right now. No unnecessary contact, no time wasting and good communication.  Well done St Austell Healthcare!!!

title: Phone service apauling
body:
I tried to phone at 12.55 after receiving a a message.. phone went dead in middle of call..tried to ring back closed between 1 &2.. phoned at 14.02 got in queue phone went dead.. then got through after 7 tries of being told busy 12th in queue  got down to 1 it started ringing then went dead..
How do you get to speak to someone
Are you closing the Crookhorn surgery
Am told by a doctor they are not working there ..blood test cancelled as no HCA

title: a very good service
body:
my wife and i attended the drive through flu vaccination on saturday
everything went very smoothly,
no waiting straight through, best one yet

author: Cheekypies1234
title: COVID-19 Testing
body:
My child was sent home from school last week with a temperature and a runny nose, therefore I booked a COVID test for her.  
The whole process was smooth, quick and easy, from the initial booking to getting results. We were booked in on the same day that I requested a test, and were even asked if we would prefer the team to come to the house!  
Once we arrived at the testing centre my little one was immediately put at ease, the nurse introduced herself and had a fantastic manner with us both. She took the time to explain what she was going to do, but in a child friendly way. She explained that it might tickle a bit and make her laugh, therefore instead of a crying child I ended up with a laughing one!  
The staff involved at all stages of the process were excellent, particularly at the testing centre and I wish to thank them for that. As a member of NHS staff I don’t envy them, especially in the wind and rain yet they still carry out their jobs with a smile on their face.

title: Disgusting
body:
I had an urgent telephone assessment as was suicidal and having a cptsd crisis.

She promised urgent support.

2 months later nothing!!!! And when you try to get through it is impossible.

The receptionist cold and unempathic, the assessment unskilful and no understanding of trauma.

I had to phone the helpline ro ask them to contact me and when they did pointless.

Absolutely disgusted with lack of care, respect and professionalism.

readBy.name: Greater Manchester Mental Health NHS Foundation Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: Sallyscally
title: Getting a 24 hour heart monitor
body: I received a 24 hour heart monitor and followed all the instructions of where and how to place the probes etc. The next morning, on removing one of the probes it pulled or burned my skin leaving me with a sore 1 1/2" by 1 1/2" mark that turned septic. I was worried as I have auto immune diseases and ended up having to buy antiseptic cream. The monitor had be put back in a wallet and you had forms on which there was personal information such as your name and hospital no. On returning the monitor, my husband went to the first window where they are returned, and discovered at least five other envelopes, all with the monitors and personal details of patients which could so easily have been stolen at any time! When my husband took the monitor into back to the window, he went into the hospital to report what he'd seen, i.e. the backlog of folders and monitors all within easy reach. No one was in the room where they were and did not seem to have been for a while. In the hospital my husband was told abruptly, "That's why the window is there, so people don't have to come in.". He then went back out of the corridor to the main reception and told the receptionist there. Who said they'd ring someone up. My husband had noted on the folder it said about the different prices of monitors and the cost to the hospital if not returned. I also phoned my own doctors for advice about the mark and they said to contact the hospital, and tell them about the monitor, but when I did they wanted to put me straight through to that same department.

readBy.name: Warrington and Halton Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: AYK
title: Visit to NHS Louisa Jordan
body: Was an extremely long walk considering I have a hip problem. I was directed to several receptions but not once offered any help to get there until a young woman with a Serco navy blue shirt on seen me and came to my aid. She got me a wheelchair, calmed me down and reassured me. She took me to the relevant area and made sure I was settled and ok before leaving me to see the consultant. My care by the medical team was excellent and very courteous. As I was leaving the area the woman appeared again and wheeled me out as far as possible to get back to my transport. I cannot thank her enough for making a very daunting experience more comfortable and adding such a human touch.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

links.id: at first very anxious & sore until serco lady

title: amazing service in different times
body: As there are some understandable concerns about GPs not seeing patients face to face, I just wanted to share an example of this ‘new’ NHS.  My husband had a very sore eye, pain in his head and blisters on his cheek.  I rang the surgery at 8am, the GP rang me at 9am.  I sent pics of his face through a special link.  The GP rang me at 10am. Said it looked like shingles.  He sent an urgent prescription to the chemist and I picked up the medication at 11am.  He spoke to the eye clinic at St Richard's and they rang me and we had an appointment that afternoon. They were really thorough and it was a relief to know that the shingles wasn't affecting his eye.  So in one day we had the best treatment without even seeing anyone until the eye clinic doctor.  I think we do have to think about doing things differently and I’m glad we were able to do it all over the phone.  It was quicker, slicker and safer.  It was amazing.  Thank you Langley House.

title: Brilliant and kind treatment
body: Child’s Bad knee cut treated quickly, efficiently and kindly - wonderful Doctor and Nurses. Child made very comfortable and relaxed and time taken to do the job properly.

title: Flu vaccine administered by drive-in
body: A quick and efficient system. Application seen by drive in team. Directed to inocculation bay. Information checked by nurse, allergy questions asked. Flu vaccine administered. Asked if I felt OK. Drove off.  Well done to all the team at the clinic who organised and administered the vaccination.

title: FLU INJECTION
body: Organisation perfect.  From receipt of letter to leaving the drive-thro .Many thanks to all involved

title: Very poor service of late
body:
I was called by a GP when I was admitted to Hospital with rib fractures.I was not at home to take the call.They sent a message asking me to call them back.I tried calling back twice.Today after holding on for 40 mts I was told there is no GP available.They asked me to call back tomorrow.This is a very poor service.Looks like nobody is responsible for monitoring the performance of the practice.Most doctors there are good,but if the patient cannot get hold of one,it is very frustrating.How long can you continue with Covid excuse?
I was an NHS Consultant.If my staff performed like this,I would have been held responsible.Why don't you allow the patients to email you like most other practices?It will save time for the staff and patients.
I have been with this practice for several years.I can see the gradual decline in service over the years even before Covid.
If you want to discuss my case,please call me as I am not willing to hold on to the phone for 40 mts every day in the hope of getting to speak to a GP.

title: Great Practice
body:
Since the takeover last year the quality of the service has greatly increased.
An ongoing condition has been identified and a change of medication/diet has much increased my stamima

title: Very good practice
body: My husband and I visited for the flu injection drive through.  An extremely efficient service. Drove in 2.58 PM for 3.00, both received injections and back home by 3.06. Well done everyone thank you.

title: Flu jab
body: Very good system for quick no fuss annual flu injection. Would use this drive through again and recommend to others.

title: Telephone Appointment
body: I recently had my face to face appointment changed to a telephone appointment due to the COVID-19 outbreak. I was told the outpatient department was closed, so I had no choice in the matter. I  much prefer face to face appointments and told my consultant that during my telephone appointment with them. I have had problems since my telephone appointment, which I wouldn't have had if I had seen my consultant in clinic. The clinic letter had the wrong dosage of medication and I am still waiting of an amended clinic letter, otherwise my GP can't prescribe me my new medication. If I had been in clinic I would have been able to get my medication from the hospital pharmacy. Please Royal Brompton open your Cardiology outpatient department again, so I can see my Consultant in person.

readBy.name: Royal Brompton and Harefield NHS Foundation Trust

title: Bad service
body: Wanted to speak to a doctor or nurse about a condition I am suffering with, and told I cant speak to anyone only if I have difficulties breathing ,it has to be a econsult, took me ages to fill out the form on line,and more difficult for older people, then it says will send you email by 6 30 PM the next evening,could be dead by then. Still waiting for them to ring .

title: Great people
body: I cant thank you enougth how you have looked after me quick efficient and most of all genuine i am not preduist what so ever you are stars and i hope people think the same

title: Fantastic service
body: I had right eye sorted in Feb 2020 then corona virus interfered and second eye sorted Aug 2020 best thing I have ever had done eyesight perfect whole experience calm and efficient and very effective Thank you so much

title: COLONOSCOPY
body:
I arrived in plenty of time(parking free was a bonus). All the Staff within the Department were Excellent, they all took their time to reassure me and made me comfortable. All were kind, caring and Professional, Thankyou.
My husband said the restaurant was excellent, every where was very clean and tidy. The whole process was quick and professional.
Well done to all.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of North Midlands NHS Trust

title: Professional and caring practice
body: My appointment was fairly quick considering current situation. The gp was friendly, caring and understanding of my situation. He prescribed me the appropriate medication and he's after care was great. I recommend this practice and helpful staff.

title: Predcriptons
body:
Shambolic service, late giving out prescriptions causing undue stress and anxiety
These are regular repeats, no excuse

title: Sad to leave this great place
body: Joined practice after being with my previous practice 20 odd years I have multiple health issues and I have inthe past worried  that things were wrong this practice listened to me and took actions which resulted in  treatment and reassurance and an ability to change the way I do things to ensure I avoid problems. I would like to say thank to every member of your team  from the Receptionists allways nice the great nurses and the Doctors it is with regret I leave but my new home is in Reading a little bit outside the area of this practice I thank you all again and I hope I can find a new practice nearly as good as you.

title: Great doctors
body: Dr surgery was great I was seen exactly at my time.. Doctor was very lovley to my daughter who is 6... He explained everything to me as he should and also understood my daughter was abit nervous. He was great talking to her telling her what he was going to do... Couldn't fault him.

title: Prompt caring response
body:
Caring efficient response from receptionist. 
Prompt sympathetic and sensible advice phone call from GP. 
Always experience excellent care  and assistance from practice staff at Emerson’s Green Medical Centre.

title: Great practice
body: I had an extraction today and was very pleased with the process . The dentist was very professional and reassuring which helped as I am a nervous patient. The practice was clean and covid safe.

title: Brilliant treatment
body: I fell off some ladders on my allotment on Thursday 10th September at about 10am and suffered a heavy fall. Despite being in a lot of pain I thought I might have got away with it but my daughter insisted I go to A&E to be checked out. I arrived at 11.45am and checked out I most certainly was - triage nurse, triage doctor, X-ray, blood test, CT scan, a cup of tea & biscuits followed by a trolley ride to Heybridge Ward A303. I arrived on ward around 3.15pm which I thought was astonishing quick in the circumstances. I had multiple cracked ribs, a cracked scapula and a partially collapsed lung - so I guess I didn't quite get away with it. I was on the ward until 7pm the following (Friday) evening. I would like to put on record that from the time of my arrival at A&E until my discharge every single person involved in my diagnosis and care went about their work in a thoroughly professional manner with good humour, treated me with respect and most of all were extremely caring, thoughtful and kind. This includes not only the many nurses & doctors, but the receptionists, cleaners & caterers. Every single one of them was a credit to their profession and, of course, themselves. Please thank all of them for the care & treatment I received, the National Health Service is a truly great service and as a nation we are lucky to have it even though all too often we take it for granted. Thank you so much!

title: Could improve
body:
I have visited Cardiology at Epsom twice in recent weeks. On both occasions I had the opportunity to observe the staff while I waited. Not all of them present in a professional way. One has long hair, not tied back which is untidy and lank, she addresses the pts as ‘love’, which is not in accordance with the Equality & Diversity guidance. Another said Ta to a pt instead of Thank You. Only a few have ID or name badges and two were discussing a pt within the hearing of people waiting. 
Some, I imagine, are unqualified but that should not mean untrained. There is a certain way people expect to be treated when they visit a hospital, professionalism at all levels is mandatory. The attitude in that unit is far too casual and relaxed.
In addition, because no name badges are worn, and they all wear theatre scrubs, it is impossible to tell what designation most of the staff are. 
I retired from nursing only a few months ago and was, at one time, a Sister within this Trust as well as a Lead Nurse in the community. I would never have allowed the sloppy image I witnessed today to exist on my watch. Times change, I appreciate that, but standards ought not to drop because of it.
I do not include the reception staff in my observation, they were perfectly professional. 
Whoever manages this unit, needs to take note and improve the presentation and attitude of the staff. It is as if some of them find it hard to draw the distinction between being in a socially relaxed situation and displaying a workplace persona. Frankly, I get a more professional attitude from my hairdresser. 
I’m sure whoever reads this will take my point.

title: distressing communication breakdown
body:
A locum referred me to the specialist as she told me i had a uterine prolapse that needed a stitch or a thread. The hospital staff reminding me of the appointment told me to take a urine sample. I attended today and was re-examined with a trainee present and told if a prolapse very early stage so no surgery needed but pelvic floor exercises and not to cough or lift anything heavy. I asked about the bowel incontinence situation and was told he was not that expert so after physiotherapy with pelvic exercise I would get referred to that expert if necessary but Covid 19 meant that it might take quite a while to arrange.
  So why was I not given any leaflets 21 years ago after birth of my last child, or by the locum, or not referred to that specialist if that is who I actually needed to see?  
Am I just meant to soil myself whenever whether in company or not meanwhile? 
Why ask for a urine sample and then not take it at the hospital?

 How is this helping me when I have gone for help and have a debilitating condition? 

It is tricky going out as it is without this hanging over me every day.  I am really distressed and although paid in all my life, no one communicates properly when I seek help.  I am left to cope, working outdoors with male colleagues often on farms where facilities are absent or miles away. 
How would the specialist feel if he were he in my shoes?

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

title: Excellent practice
body: Staff and drs always happy to help. Never have a problem with appointments or getting my medication. Drs i have spoken to and seen are always willing to listen and help as much as they can. Staff nice on phone and in person never seem to look unhappy in their work. Surgery is always clean and tidy.

title: Very very poor
body:
I had a telephone appointment book yesterday, didn’t happen, then had a missed call nearly an hour after the time, spoke to reception, said the doc would call me, didn’t happen! Booked again for today, had missed call 14:22  appointment time 14:40 Phone didn’t ring! I had phone ringer on loud & vibrate plus set an alarm 10 minutes before booked appointment!!!
Called surgery again, I’m number 59 in the que!!! Obviously I pressed to have a call back, heaven knows what time that will be! On top of that, went online & my appointment has disappeared but no doubt just like yesterday, it’ll go down as a missed appointment! NOT HAPPY AT ALL! All I want is an appointment!

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Worst reception staff
body: The reception staff at this practice are rude, unhelpful, uncivil, confrontational and obstructive. If you need to use the service you have to deal with them. Initially you will be told you cannot see a GP. Then you will be told your case is not serious enough or an emergency. I once tried to explain I knew I was not an emergency, therefore I need to see a GP and not A&E, the phone was put down. Sometimes you will be told all the appointments have already been taken and the surgery may have only been open 20minutes. However if you are lucky enough to see a GP and you need a follow up your not allowed one as they don’t do future bookings. You have to call back on the day you need the follow up. So I don’t know how a full day of appointments can be gone within 20minutes of opening. When you call back for your follow up several days/weeks later. Your told your not allowed an appointment and you don’t get to decide you need a follow up the GP does. If you try to debate this with them your spoken down to and told your wrong. I needed a sick note and was told I couldn’t have one and when I pressed why. It was because I hadn’t seen the GP after the allowed self certification time. When I explained it was because they wouldn’t let me see the GP (for the reasons already stated) they told me they couldn’t help and it wasn’t their fault I hadn’t seen the GP. As a service they repeatedly make it increasingly more difficult to see a medical professional. When you try to discuss with them they shut you down and tell you your wrong. They refuse to take responsibility for their actions and the “rules” of the service.

title: virtual consultation
body:
Excellent service which avoided the need to attend the surgery,
the technology worked extremely well visually and sound quality

title: Great service at a difficult time.
body:
Since the onset of Co-Vid 19 I have received nothing other than an excellent service from EVERY member of staff at this practice.
I have only visited the practice once in the past six months.
All other communication has been either via email or telephone.
As I was in receipt of letters from the government advising me to self isolate as much as I can until the end of July I received regular phones calls from one of the partners at the practice asking how I was and if there was anything I wanted to discuss.
This level of care at such a stressful time for everyone working in the capacity of key workers is to be applauded.
My wife has been a key worker too and acknowledges the pressure each day brings and a feeling of entering the unknown on a regular basis.
Thank you for your care and support it is very much appreciated.

title: Wonderful care as an inpatient
body: Admitted here for specialist care, I cannot fault the kindness,caring and compassion that was shown to me by all the staff that I engaged with. A wonderful asset to the community and I would recommend this hospital to anyone in need of it's inpatient services.

title: Very Well Organised
body:
My husband & I  recently went to the drive-thru for our flu injections at Hessle Grange.
The whole thing was very well organised and we were in and out in minutes. It's the first time for a drive-thru and I would definitely do it again as its so quick and staff were great.

title: Use of receptionists to give medical advice
body: I appreciate the difficult circumstances the NHS are in. I put off contacting gp for as long as i could (over 5 weeks). The receptionist obviously has to filter and direct callers but I found them to be disinterested,rude and unhelpful (as I have previously). They also gave incorrect advice  based on the symptoms I described. I also had other very personal mental health issues I needed help on which I could not bring myself to mention because of both the receptionists attitude & need to speak to a medical professional in confidence. There is a huge need for training here. I won't ever ring that number again unless I want to be completely humiliated and belittled.

title: Amazing Nurses and Doctors
body: In early July I made an appointment as I needed my coil to be removed having had the most horrendous pains. The nurse put me at ease and removed the coil, but was concerned about my condition, therefore asked the Doctor to look at me. They both conferred and between them organised my admission to hospital the same day. After a scan from the L&D it was discovered that my appendix had burst and I was operated on the same day. If the nurse from the surgery had not acted quickly and had me seen I would have died. I cannot recommend the nurse and Doctor from this practise enough for the thorough examination and quick decisions they made, which saved my life. They definitely acted above and beyond their role and I will be forever grateful. Thank you.

title: Terrible, absolutely terrible!
body: Well I would leave a decent review but for the past two days I have tried getting through to CAMHS, probably 50/60 calls per day to get help for my child. Left voicemail after voicemail, and nothing. They should have someone on the desk 24/7 weather it is for adults or kids! Unfortunately, we can't really blame the service but the NHS for the lack of funding to provide more staff to and to take on more clients.

title: medical and admin!!
body: some of the medical staff are great and conscientious but the admin staff are totally different and let this surgery down-very poor referrals and when sent full of errors,poor communication with patients queries and questions and totally dismissive when emailed and phoned-sometimes never get reply.

title: Smoking Policy
body: Why don't Tameside Hospital uphold their No Smoking policy. I'm currently sat in an external seating area with clear No Smoking anywhere in the grounds with someone smoking facing one of these signs. There are butt ends all over so it is an obvious Smoking area. If it's No Smoking then it's no Smoking. The same approach wouldn't be taken with the current virus!! Don't get me wrong, this is a great hospital giving great service. Just don't let yourselves down. Andy.

readBy.name: Tameside and Glossop Integrated Care NHS Foundation Trust
